result.execSummary:
The defendant John C. Brown Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail, Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Early termination after 18 months pending agent's recommendation.

**On 04/11/2017, JOC amended to 12 month probation**

miscConds.notes: No possession of any controlled substance without valid prescription.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail
Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

ADDRESS INFO for John C. Brown Sr.
Current: P.O. Box 44772, Madison, WI 53744 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2016)
Prior: 2035 Greenway Cross #6, Madison, WI 53713 United States
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Appearances stated:  DA Nelson, Atty. Michael Short, John C. Brown, Sr.  Ct. hears from Atty. Short requesting plea/sentencing.  Ct. agrees and amends Ct. 1 to Wis. Stat. Sec. 961.41(3g)(am).  Sentence: 24 months probation withheld, early termination eligible after 18 months pending agents recommendation), no possession of any controlled substances, AODA/follow-up, $250 DNA surcharge, $240 restitution payable to Iowa Co. Sheriff's Dept. plus costs.  Def. plead guilty to both charges.  DA Nelson states joint recommendation is acceptable.  Statement by Atty. Short.  Ct. finds sentence is appropriate and orders same.
Status conference on August 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Michael J. Short in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defendant John C. Brown in court with attorney Michael J. Short.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for John C. Brown Sr.
Current: 2035 Greenway Cross #6, Madison, WI 53713 United States  (Effective: 03-22-2016)
Prior: 212 East Walnut Street, Dodgeville, WI 53533
Status conference on May 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant John C. Brown in court, in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Short has not made contact with the Court.  Judge called Atty Short from the bench, his apperance via phone.   DA Nelson makes record on current status of case.  $1500 cash has been posted, verified we can do electronic monitoring, background check has been received on daughter.  No objection to residing with daughter at 2035 Greeway Cross # 6 in Madison on electronic monitoring - to be monitored by the ICSO.  Not anticipated to be house arrest.   Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.

No possession or use of a controlled substance without a valid prescription; residence with Jerwanda Stallworth @ 2035 Greenway Cross #6, Madison WI 53713 (608-622-6753).  Defendant to be released on electronic monitoring through the ICSO.
Bail/Bond Review on March 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant John C. Brown in court with attorney Michael J. Short.  Defendant John C. Brown in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ex 1 - Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquey given and knowing waiver accepted.  On waiver, bound over for trial.  Information filed.  Atty Short waives reading of Information.  Defendant stands mute.  Atty Short wishes to address bond criteria.  Request for signature bond with relocation in Madison.  State is hesitant about allowing defendant to relocate in Madison.  Prior record addressed.  Judge modifies bond:  requirement of criminal history check of person whom he will reside (daughter), requirement of electronic monitoring; $5000 cash to $1500 cash if these conditions are met.    Court will reconvene once conditions can be met.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Larry Nelson appears for State.  Kyle Riemann appears with client in custody.  Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing adjourned to another time.  Court hears Atty Riemann as to reducing bond.  DA objects to that.  Corrections officer Zachary Lovall sworn & testified.  Court hears DA Nelson.  Court denies modification of bond.
